result.execSummary:
The defendant Edmund Arnold Kelly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Pay mandatory DNA  surcharge and all other costs and any other surcharges. To be paid during probation and/or collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds ant to convert t a civil judgment upon release from Extended supervision or successful completion of probation.
Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Vocational/educational training.
Court advised defendant that he  may not possess any firearms; may not  vote until civil rights are restored.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Cognitive behavior therapy.
Pay supervision fees.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
No good time credit.
To serve the first six months with release for treatment and Day Reporting Center.
Balance STAYED to serve straight time for violations: serve 10 days for first violation; 20 days for second; and 45 days for third.  Balance as straight time for fourth violation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edmund Arnold Kelly

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (26 pages) PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING commencing 05-29-2014 received and filed.

Denying Request for Good Time signed and filed.
jad
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy G. Dugan, Br. 10, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se motion for good time credit.

Defendant Edmund Arnold Kelly in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Defendant Edmund Arnold Kelly in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3.5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 66 days time served.; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety
*Random urine screens. 
*Seek and maintain  fulltime employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Pay supervision fees.
The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 24 months with the following conditions:
*Defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction.  No good time credit.  Court ordered defendant to serve 1st 6 months with release for treatment and Day Reporting Center. Court stayed balance of sentence to be used as sanctions.  Court ordered defendant to serve 10 days STRAIGHT time for 1st violation; 20 days STRAIGHT time for 2nd violation; 45 days STRAIGHT time for 3rd violation and balance as STRAIGHT time for 4th violation.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety
*Random urine screens. 
*Seek and maintain  fulltime employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Pay supervision fees.

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
Defendant to pay DNA SURCHARGE and all other costs and any other surcharges during probation and/or collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release from extended supervision or successful completion of probation.

Court informed defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed,
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
-Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief;
-Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;

of DISCHARGE from Justice Point Pretrial Services; filed.

Defendant Edmund Arnold Kelly in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Defendant Edmund Arnold Kelly in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

This matter was originally scheduled for a Plea Hearing today, however, the parties wish to proceed in a different manner.
The defendant picked up a bail jumping charge (ref. case# 14CF1444).
Parties request to adjourn this matter along with case# 14CF1444.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 05-29-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.

Attorney James Eric Goldmann in court.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is excused today; this case is originally scheduled on this Friday.
Parties request to schedule a projected plea hearing date and cancel the scheduling conference on 03-14-2014.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 04-16-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.

14RM012123  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/3/14 vf

Defendant Edmund Arnold Kelly in court with attorney James Eric Goldmann.  Defendant Edmund Arnold Kelly in custody.  Paul Hauer for Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Edmund Arnold Kelly in court with attorney Matthew Lamke.  Defendant Edmund Arnold Kelly in custody.  Maureen A. Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
